Setting up .bash_profile for Git Terminal Mac OSX

October 19, 2017
1

Step 1. Download

Download following files.

  • git-completion
  • git-prompt

Step 2. Move

Move this files under your user’s root directory.

In my case it is /Users/sagar

Step 3. Edit your .bash_profile

This file is usually located under user’s root directory. In my case it is /Users/sagar. Open .bash_profile with editor of your preference. I prefer vi editor. Insert following lines.

# Enable tab completion
source ~/git-completion.bash

# colors!
green="\[\033[0;32m\]"
blue="\[\033[0;34m\]"
purple="\[\033[0;35m\]"
reset="\[\033[0m\]"

# Change command prompt
source ~/git-prompt.sh
export GIT_PS1_SHOWDIRTYSTATE=1
# '\u' adds the name of the current user to the prompt
# '\$(__git_ps1)' adds git-related stuff
# '\W' adds the name of the current directory
export PS1="$purple\u$green\$(__git_ps1)$blue \W $ $reset"
